thread.title: Warren Hills' Saturday night football game postponed
thread.title_full: Warren Hills' Saturday night football game postponed

title: Warren Hills' Saturday night football game postponed
text:
By Jim Deegan | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 02, 2015 3:26 PM, updated October 02, 2015 3:58 PM View/Post Comments 
Saturday night's Voorhees at Warren Hills football game has been postponed. 
Voorhees athletic director Al Stumpf said officials decided to postpone the game "because of this week's series of events." 
The game was to be the first since Warren Hills quarterback Evan Murray died after suffering a lacerated spleen in last Friday night's game. 
This week's game was originally scheduled for Friday night but was pushed back to Saturday in the wake of Murray's death. 
A message on the Warren Hills Regional School District website said all Warren Hills activities and athletic events Saturday from grades 7 through 12 were being postponed. 
The varsity football game will be rescheduled, the district said. 
Voorhees' Stumpf said a makeup date hasn't been decided and officials were working to determine when the game could be played. 
Murray, 17, was a three-year starter on the football team who also played baseball and basketball. Hundreds attended his viewing Wednesday at Faith Discovery Church and the funeral Thursday .
